intro: Stephania crebra, commonly known as the narrow-leafed Chinese yew, is a flowering plant native to eastern Asia. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its climbing habit and compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are typically clustered in racemes. Its fruit is a follicle that splits open to release flat, winged seeds. Stephania crebra is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
